questions.question: Which ancient ruin in South America is renowned for its terraced architecture and is situated in the Sacred Valley of the Incas?
questions.context: Built in the 15th century and rediscovered in 1911, it’s one of the most iconic archaeological sites in the world, believed to have been an estate for the Inca emperor Pachacuti.

questions.question: Which famous museum located in a European capital was opened to the public in 1793 and has over 38,000 objects on display?
questions.context: Originally constructed as a fortress in the late 12th century, it’s home to the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo.

questions.question: Which UNESCO site in Asia is famed for its coral reefs and marine biodiversity, attracting divers from around the world?
questions.context: Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1993, this atoll reef system is a sanctuary for marine life and a haven for conservation efforts.

questions.question: What historical battle site in Belgium saw a decisive battle in 1815 that marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars?
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo was fought on June 18, 1815, where Napoleon Bonaparte was defeated by the Duke of Wellington and Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in the Middle East features two iconic curved towers and opened in 2008 as a symbol of modern design?
questions.context: This building is the first circular skyscraper in the Middle East, known for its striking aesthetic and was awarded a LEED Silver certification for environmental sustainability.
